Interface Board

All Known Implementing Classes:
GameBoard
public interface Board
Interface contract defining the core game board operations for Tetris. Provides methods for brick movement, rotation, game state management, and special game modes.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    ClearRow
    checkClears()
    Checks for completed rows that should be cleared.
    void
    commitClear(ClearRow clearRow)
    Applies the cleared rows and updates the board matrix.

    getCurrentShape()

    int
    getGhostY(int currentX, int currentY)
    Calculates the Y position where the ghost piece (preview of landing position) should be displayed.
    List<Integer>

    Gets a list of row indices that are fully filled and ready to be cleared.

    Gets the Score object tracking game statistics.

    Gets view data containing current brick, next bricks, and held brick information.
    int
    hardDrop()
    Instantly drops the current brick to its lowest valid position.
    void
    holdBrick()
    Swaps the current brick with the held brick, or holds the current brick if none is held.
    void
    mergeBrickToBackground()
    Merges the current falling brick into the background board matrix.

    newGame()
    Resets the game board to start a new game.
    boolean
    rotateLeftBrick()
    Rotates the current brick counter-clockwise with wall kick support.
    void
    setupPuzzleMode()
    Sets up the board for Puzzle mode by generating garbage rows at the bottom.

  • Method Details

    • moveBrickDown

      boolean moveBrickDown()
      Moves the current brick down by one position.
      Returns:
      true if the move was successful, false if collision occurred

    • moveBrickLeft

      boolean moveBrickLeft()
      Moves the current brick left by one position.
      Returns:
      true if the move was successful, false if collision occurred

    • moveBrickRight

      boolean moveBrickRight()
      Moves the current brick right by one position.
      Returns:
      true if the move was successful, false if collision occurred

    • rotateLeftBrick

      boolean rotateLeftBrick()
      Rotates the current brick counter-clockwise with wall kick support.
      Returns:
      true if rotation was successful, false if rotation would cause collision

    • createNewBrick

      boolean createNewBrick()
      Creates and spawns a new brick at the starting position.
      Returns:
      true if the brick can be placed, false if game over condition is met

    • getBoardMatrix

      int[][] getBoardMatrix()
      Gets a copy of the current game board matrix.
      Returns:
      2D array representing the board state where 0 is empty and non-zero values represent brick colors

    • getViewData

      ViewData getViewData()
      Gets view data containing current brick, next bricks, and held brick information.
      Returns:
      ViewData object containing all information needed for rendering

    • mergeBrickToBackground

      void mergeBrickToBackground()
      Merges the current falling brick into the background board matrix.

    • checkClears

      ClearRow checkClears()
      Checks for completed rows that should be cleared.
      Returns:
      ClearRow object containing information about cleared rows and the new matrix state

    • commitClear

      void commitClear(ClearRow clearRow)
      Applies the cleared rows and updates the board matrix.
      Parameters:
      clearRow - ClearRow object containing the new matrix state after clearing

    • getScore

      Score getScore()
      Gets the Score object tracking game statistics.
      Returns:
      Score object containing score, lines cleared, and combo information

    • newGame

      void newGame()
      Resets the game board to start a new game.

    • getGhostY

      int getGhostY(int currentX, int currentY)
      Calculates the Y position where the ghost piece (preview of landing position) should be displayed.
      Parameters:
      currentX - Current X position of the brick
      currentY - Current Y position of the brick
      Returns:
      Y coordinate where the brick would land if dropped

    • getCurrentShape

      int[][] getCurrentShape()
      Gets a copy of the current falling brick's shape matrix.
      Returns:
      2D array representing the current brick's shape

    • hardDrop

      int hardDrop()
      Instantly drops the current brick to its lowest valid position.
      Returns:
      The number of rows the brick was dropped

    • getRowsToClear

      List<Integer> getRowsToClear()
      Gets a list of row indices that are fully filled and ready to be cleared.
      Returns:
      List of row indices (0-based) that should be cleared

    • setupPuzzleMode

      void setupPuzzleMode()
      Sets up the board for Puzzle mode by generating garbage rows at the bottom.

    • holdBrick

      void holdBrick()
      Swaps the current brick with the held brick, or holds the current brick if none is held.
